title: Chord: Dominant 7th in C (Shape: C)
content:
# Dominant 7th Chord in C

The Dominant 7th chord in the key of C is based on the note G. As a C7 chord, it comprises the notes C, E, G, and Bb. This chord creates tension and a strong desire to resolve to the tonic chord (C major). It adds a bluesy and jazzy flavor to music due to the tritone interval between the E and Bb notes.

## Notes and Intervals
- C (Root)
- E (Major 3rd)
- G (Perfect 5th)
- Bb (Minor 7th)

## Musical Flavor
The Dominant 7th chord in C, also known as the C7 chord, is commonly used in blues, jazz, funk, and rock music. It provides a sense of tension and a leading quality due to the dissonant interval between the major third (E) and minor seventh (Bb). This chord often resolves smoothly to the tonic chord, creating a satisfying musical resolution.

## Songs
1. "Hound Dog" by Elvis Presley
2. "Everyday I Have the Blues" by B.B. King
3. "I'm Just a Singer (In a Rock and Roll Band)" by The Moody Blues
